"If Congress creates election reform, it should be on a bipartisan basis. The greatest threat to our election system is partisanship." #HR1 #Notforthepeople

"Although the Democratic majority claim they want to take money out of politics, they are using H.R. 1 to funnel money into their own campaigns and every Member who votes for this bill is voting to line the pockets of their own campaigns."

"H.R. 1 limits free speech and imposes vague standards that disadvantage American citizens who want to advocate on behalf of policy they believe in... Every American should be able to speak on an issue they‚Äôre passionate about."

"Congress should partner with states, who understand the unique needs of their residents, and provide support to increase voter registration and improve election security, instead of federally mandating this ‚Äúone size fits all‚Äù approach."

"I am for the American voter. I support every eligible voter having easier ways to register to vote and easier access to the polls.  What I am not for is Washington, D.C. taking over and now paying for federal elections."

The most egregious provision of #HR1 is the 6:1 government match on funds for federal political races. ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt need more money in politics.‚Äù -Ranking Member @RodneyDavis pic.twitter.com/lB7QMUa6Ir

10. Forces states to count provisional ballots cast outside of the voter's correct precinct which will inevitably result in the election of candidates at the state and local level by non-qualified residents.

9. Impedes states‚Äô ability to determine their registration and voting practices, as protected under Article 1, Section 4 of the Constitution and violates separation of powers by Congress mandating ethics standards for the Supreme Court. #HR1 is a constitutional overreach.
8. Does not provide states adequate enforcement mechanisms to guard against fraud.

7. Disregards state voter identification laws by allowing sworn statements to be used in place of identification and allowing for signature verification, which can be submitted through a photo if the voter registers online.

6. Diminishes the process of Election Day voting by expanding ‚Äúno excuse‚Äù absentee voting and allowing for any eligible voter to be able to cast their ballot by mail with no additional safeguards to this process.

5. Raises constitutional concerns under the First Amendment by proposing to limit free speech and imposing vague standards that disadvantage all groups who wish to advocate on behalf of any legislative issue.

4. Weakens our voting system by increasing the election system‚Äôs vulnerability & failing to implement necessary checks & balances for who is registering to vote. #HR1 will force states to allow online & automatic voter registration & same-day voter registration w/ no safeguards.

3. Weaponizes the @FEC by altering the current bipartisan makeup of a six-member commission to a partisan five-member commission which will limit free speech and make partisan decisions about election communications.
2. Creates a new voucher pilot program that grants eligible voters a $25 voucher of hard-earned taxpayer dollars to donate to any campaign of their choosing.
1. Creates a 6:1 government match to any small donor contributions of $200 or less in a congressional or presidential campaign, meaning for every $200, the federal government will match $1,200.
Top 10 Most Egregious of Provisions #HR1:  https://republicans-cha.house.gov/press-release/top-10-most-egregious-provisions-hr-1¬†‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/mdMQ0FUjzE
We just recently received the CBO score of #HR1 which egregiously underestimated the cost of #HR1 to taxpayers by conveniently leaving out many of the legislation‚Äôs most expensive provisions.
Election reform should be bipartisan, not serving the interest of politicians. #HR1
Under #HR1 Neo-Nazis running for Congress would be eligible to receive taxpayer dollars for their campaign.
If #HR1 goes into effect, congressional candidates could potentially receive $4.3 million of taxpayer dollars to fund their campaigns. We are creating a political ATM through campaign subsidies.
For every $200, the federal government will pay $1,200 of taxpayer money to a politician‚Äôs campaign.

#HR1 campaign match provision is an outrageous cost to the American taxpayers. #HR1 is creating public subsidies through the 6 to 1 government match on small-donor campaign contributions of up to $200.

My colleagues across the aisle insist that #HR1 is their serious effort for election reform, yet the development of #HR1 has been a rushed process that has not offered many Members and Committees due consideration of the legislation before forcing a vote in the House.

When #HR1 was introduced, it was referred to 10 House committees who were each designated to have jurisdiction over areas of the legislation. Out of those 10, only 5 Committees have held hearings on #HR1 and out of those 5, only CHA held a markup.

Make no mistake, #HR1 was developed to serve the special interests of Democrats and the outside organizations that support the Democratic Party. We are failing the people if we don't do our due diligence to create bipartisan election reform that will protect each American voter.
The greatest threat to our nation's election system is partisanship. During our committee markup of #HR1 last week, we considered 28 amendments offered by CHA Rs and not a single one was adopted.
